popt4jlib.neural

Class MultiClassSSE

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.BaseNNNode
      • popt4jlib.neural.MultiClassSSE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, NNNodeIntf, OutputNNNodeIntf

    public class MultiClassSSE
extends BaseNNNode
implements OutputNNNodeIntf
    class implements the max input signal position selector when acting as an input training instance evaluator. However, during FFNN training, the output it computes is the sum of the square errors of each of its input signals which must equal the number of classes in the training set. These input signals must be in the range [0,1] (thus the Sigmoid or TanH01 classes are best suited for this last hidden layer). Obviously weights of the last hidden layer towards this output node are not used. This class should be used together with the popt4jlib.neural.costfunction.L1Norm (or alternatively, the popt4jlib.neural.costfunction.MAE) cost functions, as it already computes as error the sum of square errors of each of the (sigmoid?) nodes in the previous layer. Notice when used as hidden node (not output), this class is discontinuous (thus NOT differentiable) wherever the max value is attained by more than one argument. In all other cases the partial derivative is zero. This implies that the class should only be used as output node!

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:

      same as evalB(s,w) method, but the 2nd argument is now assumed to hold as last element the bias term for this node (still goes unused).

      called when the node is used as output node during training.

      evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index, using the grad vector thread local cache.

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        public double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                                     int index,
                                     double[] inputSignals,
                                     double true_lbl,
                                     java.util.HashMap p)
        evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index. The derivative for this node exists everywhere when it is used as the output node.
        Specified by:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in interface NNNodeIntf
        Overrides:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in class BaseNNNode
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        inputSignals - double[]
        true_lbl - double
        p - HashMap includes the train-data matrix and train-labels array
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this node is not the output node of the network it belongs to

        evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index, using the grad vector thread local cache.
